attributes.action: A permanent memorial to be erected on the spot Drummer Lee Rigby was murdered.
attributes.background: We would like to see a permanent memorial at the very spot Drummer Lee Rigby was murdered. The memorial should be visible 24 hours a day and should not kept away from daylight in a church.The memorial should a be lasting memorial and to highlight why his life should be remembered.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of the Royal Borough of Greenwich.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor. You can use this page to find out who the local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can find out how to petition the council here:

http://www.royalgreenwich.gov.uk/info/354/council_-_minutes_agendas_and_reports/213/your_rights_at_council_meetings/5
